00015 int TOctalFADCIsland::GetMax(int first, int last) const
00016 {
00017   if(last < first || last >= fData.size() || first < 0){
00018     cerr << "TOctalFADCIsland::GetMax() : Error! arguments out of range." << endl;
00019   }
00020   // max_element returns an iterator to the maximum element in the range.
00021   return *(std::max_element(fData.begin() + first, fData.begin() + last + 1));
00022 }
00023 
00024 int TOctalFADCIsland::GetMaxBin(int first, int last) const
00025 {
00026   if(last < first || last >= fData.size() || first < 0)
00027   {
00028     cout << "first = " << first << "   last : " << last << "   size : " << fData.size() << endl;
00029     cerr << "TOctalFADCIsland::GetMaxBin() : Error! arguments out of range." << endl;
00030   }
00031   //cout << "(good one) first = " << first << "   last : " << last << "   size : " << fData.size() << endl;
00032   // vector iterators obey pointer arithmetic - the subtraction gives the index
00033   return std::max_element(fData.begin()+first,fData.begin()+last+1) 
00034             - fData.begin();
00035  
00036 }

00038 
00039 double TOctalFADCIsland::GetAverageMax(int nAv, int first, int last) const
00040 {
00041   if(last < first || last >= fData.size() || first < 0 || nAv < 0){
00042     cerr << "TOctalFADCIsland::GetAverageMax() : Error! arguments out of range." << endl;
00043   }
00044 
00045   int maxbin = GetMaxBin(first,last);
00046   int sum = *(std::max_element(fData.begin()+first,fData.begin()+last+1));
00047   int skipped = 0;
00048   int ind;
00049 
00050   for(int i  = 1; i <= nAv; i++)
00051   {
00052     ind = maxbin + static_cast<int>((i/2.+ 0.5)*pow(-1,i));
00053     if(ind > first && ind < last){sum = sum + fData[ind];}
00054     else{skipped++;}     
00055   }
00056 
00057     return static_cast<double>(sum)/(nAv+1.-skipped);
00058 }

00062 int TOctalFADCIsland::GetMaxBinBlockTime(int first, int last) const
00063 {
00064   if(last < first || last >= fData.size() || first < 0){
00065     cerr << "TOctalFADCIsland::GetMaxBinBlockTime() : Error! arguments out of range." << endl;
00066   }
00067   return GetTime() + GetMaxBin(first,last); 
00068 }

00070 int TOctalFADCIsland::GetCFBlockTime(int first, int last) const // 
00071 {
00072   if(last < first || last >= fData.size() || first < 0){
00073     cerr << "TOctalFADCIsland::GetCFBlockTime() : Error! arguments out of range."
00074          << endl;
00075   }
00076   return GetCFBin(first,last)+GetTime(); 
00077 }
00078 
00079 int TOctalFADCIsland::GetCFBin(int first, int last) const //Will miss a bit if there is a overflow of the FADC. If the timing of high energy signals becomes an issue, this algorithm will have to be come a little bit more sofisticated
00080 {
00081   if(last < first || last >= fData.size() || first < 0){
00082     cerr << "TOctalFADCIsland::GetCFBlockTime() : Error! arguments out of range." << endl;
00083 
00084   }
00085 
00086   int max = GetMax(first,last)-fData[first];//taken the non zero pedestal into account
00087   int maxbin = GetMaxBin(first,last);
00088   double halfmax = max/2.;
00089   int constantFraction = first;
00090   double value = -1.;
00091 
00092   while( value < halfmax && constantFraction < maxbin)
00093   {
00094     value = static_cast<double>(fData[constantFraction]);
00095     constantFraction++;
00096   }
00097 
00098   return constantFraction; 
00099 }
00100 
00101 double TOctalFADCIsland::GetAverage(int first, int last) const
00102 {
00103   if(last < first ){return -1.;}
00104   if(first<0){first=0;}
00105   if(last >= fData.size()){last = fData.size();}
00106 
00107   int sum = 0;
00108   int N = 0;
00109 
00110   for(int i = first; i <= last; i++)
00111   {
00112     sum += fData[i];
00113     N += 1;
00114   }
00115 
00116   return static_cast<double>(sum)/N;
00117 }

00120 double TOctalFADCIsland::GetTimeNs() const
00121 {
00122   double period = octalfadc_parameters.kClockPeriod[fChannel];
00123   return fTime*period;
00124 }

00126 double TOctalFADCIsland::GetIntegral(int first, int last) const
00127 {
00128   if(last < first ){return -1.;}
00129   if(first<0){first=0;}
00130   if(last >= fData.size()){last = fData.size();}
00131 
00132   int sum = 0;
00133   
00134   for(int i = first; i <= last; i++)
00135   {
00136     sum += fData[i];
00137   }
00138 
00139   return static_cast<double>(sum);
00140 }

00144 //this is optimized for a Ge detector!
00145 bool TOctalFADCIsland::GoodPulse(int shapTime, double clockPeriod, int level) // Do not reject pulse with noisy spikes, just tag them in the hits object
00146 {
00147   int secondSample = 1;
00148   int oneButLast = fData.size() - 1;
00149   int maxbin = GetMaxBin();
00150   int channel = GetFADCChannel();
00151   int threshold = octalfadc_parameters.threshold[channel];
00152 
00153   if(fData.size()*clockPeriod < static_cast<double>(shapTime) && level >= 1){SetPulseQuality(1);return false;} //A good pulse is longer then the shaping time. For a non-shaped PMT pulse you just can send the width,
00154 
00155   //This doesn`t work so well. Energy samples which are missing a piece, but have a nice maximum, are not accepted. Also good timing pulses with an undershoot don`t make it.
00156   //else if( abs(fData[secondSample] - fData[oneButLast] ) > 50 && level >= 2){return false;} //The first and the last few samples should be about the same value. "50" is somewhat arbitary
00157   
00158   //Alternative: asking that the maximum doesn`t set at the edge (12.5% on each side) of the island
00159   else if( ( static_cast<double>(maxbin) < fData.size()/12. || static_cast<double>(maxbin) > 11*fData.size()/12. ) && level >=2) { SetPulseQuality(2);return false;}
00160 
00161   else if( ( GetMax() < threshold && level >=3 )) {SetPulseQuality(3);return false;}
00162 
00163   else if( abs(*(std::max_element(fData.begin(), fData.begin() + fData.size())) - *(std::max_element(fData.begin(), fData.begin() + fData.size()) + 1)) > 50 && level >= 4){SetPulseQuality(4);return false;} //eleminating spikes, again the "50" is arbitary. Might be dangerous for very sharp PMT pulses
00164 
00165   else{SetPulseQuality(0);return true;}
00166 
00167 }

00169 // This method is customized for the run4 Ge datasets
00170 bool TOctalFADCIsland::GoodPulse(int shapTime, double clockPeriod, int ped, int runnr, int level, int channel) 
00171 {
00172   int secondSample = 1;
00173   int oneButLast = fData.size() - 1;
00174   int maxbin = GetMaxBin();
00175   double max = static_cast<double>(GetMax());
00176   double leftAv = GetAverage(maxbin-40,maxbin-30);
00177   double rightAv = GetAverage(maxbin+30,maxbin+40);
00178   double totalAv = GetAverage();
00179   double pedestal = static_cast<double>(ped);
00180 
00181   double ampCut_a = 0;
00182   double ampCut_b = 0;
00183   double avCut_a = 1.;
00184   double avCut_b = 0.;//"_a" is for the Drop Maximum method, "_b" is for the Island Average method
00185 
00186   if((runnr >= 51683) &&(runnr <= 51984))
00187   {
00188     if(channel == 1){ampCut_a = 2500; avCut_a = 0.04; ampCut_b = 2700; avCut_b = 0.75;} //channel 1 = HG, channel 2 = LG
00189     if(channel == 2){ampCut_a = 1380; avCut_a = 0.032; ampCut_b = 1385; avCut_b = 0.975;}
00190   }
00191   if((runnr >= 51985) &&(runnr <= 52280))
00192   {
00193     if(channel == 1){ampCut_a = 2500; avCut_a = 0.04; ampCut_b = 2500; avCut_b = 0.8;}
00194     if(channel == 2){ampCut_a = 1500; avCut_a = 0.022; ampCut_b = 1510; avCut_b = 0.935;}
00195     //if(channel == 2){ampCut_a = 1500; avCut_a = 0.022; ampCut_b = 1510; avCut_b = 0.935;}
00196   }
00197 
00198   if(fData.size()*clockPeriod < static_cast<double>(shapTime) && level >= 1){SetPulseQuality(1);return false;} //A good pulse is longer then the shaping time. For a non-shaped PMT pulse you just can send the width,
00199 
00200   //This doesn`t work so well. Energy samples which are missing a piece, but have a nice maximum, are not accepted. Also good timing pulses with an undershoot don`t make it.
00201   //else if( abs(fData[secondSample] - fData[oneButLast] ) > 50 && level >= 2){return false;} //The first and the last few samples should be about the same value. "50" is somewhat arbitary
00202 
00203   //Alternative: asking that the maximum doesn`t set at the edge (12.5% on each side) of the island
00204   else if( ( static_cast<double>(maxbin) < fData.size()/12. || static_cast<double>(maxbin) > 11*fData.size()/12. ) && level >=2){ SetPulseQuality(2);return false;}
00205 
00206   else if( abs(*(std::max_element(fData.begin(), fData.begin() + fData.size())) - *(std::max_element(fData.begin(), fData.begin() + fData.size()) + 1)) > 50 && level >= 3){SetPulseQuality(3);return false;} //eleminating spikes, again the "50" is arbitary. Might be dangerous for very sharp PMT pulses
00207 
00208   //This checks if the pulse drops fast enough next to the maximum
00209   else if( level >=4 && ( fabs((leftAv - max)/(max - pedestal))  < avCut_a && max > ampCut_a) ){SetPulseQuality(4);return false;}
00210   else if( level >=4 && ( fabs((rightAv - max)/(max - pedestal))  < avCut_a && max > ampCut_a) ){SetPulseQuality(4);return false;}
00211 
00212   //checks if the Average (~integral) is consistent with the amplitude 
00213   else if( level >=5 && ( totalAv/max > avCut_b && max > ampCut_b ) ) {SetPulseQuality(5);return false;}
00214 
00215 
00216   else{SetPulseQuality(0);return true;}
00217 //printf("max = %f,avCut_a = %f, ampCut_a = %f, Figure of Merit (R) = %f\n",max ,avCut_a,ampCut_a,fabs((rightAv - max)/(max - pedestal)));
00218 //printf("max = %f, avCut_a = %f, ampCut_a = %f, Figure of Merit (L) = %f\n",max ,avCut_a,ampCut_a,fabs((leftAv - max)/(max - pedestal)));
00219 //printf("Max = %f, Pedestal = %f, LeftAv = %f, Figure of merit = %f \n", max,pedestal,leftAv,fabs((leftAv - max)/(max - pedestal)) );printf("Max = %f, Pedestal = %f, RightAv = %f, Figure of merit = %f \n", max,pedestal, rightAv,fabs((rightAv - max)/(max - pedestal)) );
00220 
00221 }
00222 
00223 int TOctalFADCIsland::FitGauss(int left, int right, int shapTime, double clockPeriod, int pedestal) 
00224 {
00225   int size = fData.size();
00226   if( GetMaxBin() - left < 1) { return 0; }
00227   if(GetMaxBin() + right > size -1) { return 0; }
00228   
00229   TH1I* hIsland = new TH1I("hIsland","The OctalFADCIsland as a Histogram instead of a vector",size,0,size);
00230   for(int i = 0; i<size; i++) { hIsland->SetBinContent(i+1,fData[i]);}
00231   
00232   TF1* myG = new TF1("myG", "gaus(0)+[3]", GetMaxBin()-left,GetMaxBin()+right);
00233   myG->SetParLimits(1, left+1., right-1.);
00234   myG->SetParLimits(2, shapTime/(4.*clockPeriod), (shapTime*4.)/clockPeriod);
00235   myG->FixParameter(3, pedestal*1.);
00236   //myG->SetParLimits(3,octalfadc_parameters.pedestalGeHighGainchannel-500,octalfadc_parameters.pedestalGeHighGainchannel+100);
00237 
00238   hIsland->Fit("myG","RQ");
00239 
00240   double chiSqr = myG->GetChisquare();
00241   double maxbin = myG->GetParameter(1);
00242   double max = myG->GetMaximum();
00243   int NDF = myG->GetNDF();
00244 
00245   SetChiSqrRed(chiSqr/NDF);
00246   SetMaxBinGauss (maxbin);
00247   SetMaxGauss(max);
00248 
00249   //printf("Size = %d  Pulse Quality = %d  Chi Sqr = %.1f  NDF = %d   Fitted amp = %f  Amplitude = %d \n", size, GetPulseQuality(), myG->GetChisquare(), myG->GetNDF(),max,GetMax());
00250 
00251   delete hIsland;
00252   delete myG;
00253 
00254   if(chiSqr/NDF > 5.){ return 0; }
00255 
00256   return 1;
00257 }
